text: Charity Chetachukwu Reuben (born December 25, 2000) is a Nigerian footballer, who plays for BIIK Kazygurt. She previously represented Ibom Angels in the Nigeria Women Premier League, and Nigeria women's national under-20 football team. For the 2017 Nigeria Women Premier League, she scored eight goals, which was the most by any player in the league. == Career == After joining from Rivers Angels in 2015, Reuben scored six goals during the 2016 Nigeria Women Premier League. Charity featured for Nigeria at the 2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup. In February 2018, she was nominated by the Nigeria Football Federation for 2017 Women Player of the Year. In May 2018, she was nominated as the best player in the 2017 Nigeria Women Premier League at Nigeria Pitch Awards, but lost the award to Rasheedat Ajibade. Charity Reuben plays in the Kazakhstan women's league for BIIK Kazygurt football club since 2019. == References == ==External links== * * Category:Nigerian women's footballers Category:Living people Category:2000 births Category:Expatriate women's footballers in Kazakhstan Category:Nigerian expatriate sportspeople in Kazakhstan Category:Rivers Angels F.C. players Category:BIIK Kazygurt players Category:Women's association football forwards Category:Bayelsa Queens F.C. players Category:Ibom Angels F.C. players
title: Charity Reuben
